title: PIANO STRATEGICO PER LO SVILUPPO DELLA RETE CICLOTURISTICA TRANSFRONTALIERA NELL’AREA INTERREG IIIIA DELLA REGIONE LOMBARDIA E DELLA SVIZZERA - TERRITORI DI VARESE, COMO, LECCO E SONDRIO
abstract: “Bike Network - Piano strategico per lo sviluppo della rete cicloturistica transfrontaliera” punta alla costituzione di una rete ciclabile transfrontaliera italo-svizzera, che comprenda le principali zone di interesse turistico dei laghi Maggiore, Ceresio e Lario, e si integri ai sistemi ciclabili della provincia di Sondrio e delle valli di collegamento con i Cantoni Ticino e Grigioni. L’obiettivo principale del progetto e quello di valorizzare le risorse territoriali e il patrimonio locale della fascia trasfrontaliera italo-svizzera sia attraverso l’integrazione di progetti di valorizzazione gia promossi o programmati, sia attraverso l’individuazione delle componenti naturalistiche, culturali e sportive dell’area, favorendo in tal senso una nuova interpretazione del territorio in chiave turisticoculturale. Inoltre si mira a favorire l’uscita dalla marginalita delle comunita transfrontaliere, incentivando nuove forme di collaborazione e l’attivazione di partenariati per la condivisione di progetti di sviluppo interregionali, rafforzando cosi l’identita culturale del territorio e la sua comunicazione verso l’esterno. In questo contesto l’individuazione di percorsi ciclabili di collegamento transfrontaliero ed interprovinciale, e la definizione di itinerari ciclo-pedonali che valorizzino gli aspetti turistico-culturali delle Province e Regioni coinvolte nel progetto, rappresentano uno strumento fondamentale sia per rafforzare l’identita locale, sia per valorizzare e dare unitarieta alle numerose progettualita a favore della mobilita lenta e del turismo sostenibile. Contestualmente all’identificazione del network di percorsi ciclabili individuati dal progetto, verranno promosse opportune politiche a sostegno dell’intermodalita su ferro, gomma e acqua, al fine di garantire all’utenza ciclo-pedonale e turistica una mobilita totale nell’area e una migliore accessibilita e raggiungibilita delle risorse territoriali.

motivations: There is a need to enhance the tourism industry and promote sustainable mobility in the transboundary area between Italy and Switzerland.
Local communities in the transboundary area are marginalized and require new forms of collaboration and development projects to strengthen their cultural identity.
objectives: Establish a transboundary cycling network that connects the main tourist areas of the lakes Maggiore, Ceresio, and Lario.
Promote the local heritage and territorial resources through the integration of existing projects and the identification of naturalistic, cultural, and sportive components.
Foster new forms of collaboration and partnerships for interregional development projects.
methods: Identify and develop transboundary and interprovincial cycling routes and pedestrian itineraries that enhance the tourist-cultural aspects of the involved provinces and regions.
Promote policies supporting intermodality on rail, road, and water to ensure total mobility and accessibility in the area.
Integrate existing projects and initiatives to strengthen local identity and promote sustainable tourism.
results: Enhance the local identity and cultural heritage of the transboundary area.
Promote sustainable tourism and mobility in the region.
Foster collaboration and partnerships among local communities and stakeholders.
llama_json.research_subject: Development of a transboundary cycling network and sustainable tourism in the Italy-Switzerland border region

motivations: There is a need to enhance the territorial resources and local heritage of the Italian-Swiss border area through the integration of existing and planned valorization projects.

The project aims to promote new forms of collaboration and partnerships for the development of interregional projects, thereby strengthening the cultural identity of the territory and its external communication.

The project seeks to promote slow mobility and sustainable tourism by creating a transborder and interprovincial cycling network that highlights the tourist-cultural aspects of the Provinces and Regions involved.
objectives: Establish an Italian-Swiss transborder cycling network that includes the main tourist areas of the Maggiore, Ceresio, and Lario lakes, and integrates with the cycling systems of the Sondrio province and the valleys connecting with the Ticino and Grisons cantons.
Promote the territorial resources and local heritage of the Italian-Swiss border area through the integration of existing and planned valorization projects.
Promote new forms of collaboration and partnerships for the development of interregional projects, thereby strengthening the cultural identity of the territory and its external communication.
methods: Identify transborder and interprovincial cycling routes and define cycle-pedestrian itineraries that highlight the tourist-cultural aspects of the Provinces and Regions involved in the project.

Promote appropriate policies to support intermodality on rail, rubber, and water, in order to guarantee total mobility in the area and better accessibility and reachability of territorial resources for cycle-pedestrian and tourist users.
results: Strengthen the local identity and promote and unify numerous projects in favor of slow mobility and sustainable tourism.
Improve accessibility and reachability of territorial resources for cycle-pedestrian and tourist users.
Promote new forms of collaboration and partnerships for the development of interregional projects.
openai_json.research_subject: Strategic development of a transborder cycling network in the Lombardy region and Switzerland

motivations: The Italian-Swiss cross-border communities face marginalization and lack integrated sustainable tourism infrastructure.
There is a need to valorize and integrate the territorial resources and local heritage of the cross-border area between Italy and Switzerland.
objectives: Establish a cross-border cycling network connecting the main tourist areas of Lakes Maggiore, Ceresio, and Lario with the cycling systems of Sondrio province and valleys linking to Ticino and Grisons Cantons.
Promote the valorization of naturalistic, cultural, and sporting components of the area through integrated tourism development projects.
Foster cross-border collaboration and partnerships to strengthen the cultural identity of the territory and enhance its external communication.
methods: Identify cross-border and inter-provincial cycling routes that highlight the tourist-cultural aspects of the involved provinces and regions.
Promote intermodal transport policies integrating rail, road, and water transportation to ensure comprehensive mobility for cyclists and tourists.
Integrate existing and planned valorization projects to create a unified approach to slow mobility and sustainable tourism.
results: Creation of an integrated cross-border cycling network that enhances territorial resources and promotes sustainable tourism.
Strengthened cultural identity and improved external visibility of the cross-border territory.
Enhanced accessibility and connectivity of territorial resources through improved intermodal transportation options.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Development of a cross-border cycling tourism network between Lombardy Region and Switzerland
